reference_solution:
f = float(input())
c = round((f - 32)* 5 /9,2)
print('Fahrenheit temperature {} is same as {} degree Celsius.'.format(f, c))
statement: Write a program which takes as input Fahrenheit temperature. It converts the input temperature to Celsius and print out the converted temperature as shown in the example. NOTE: 1. DO NOT use any prompts in the input(). 2. Formula for conversion: $$C = (F - 32) \times 5 / 9$$ 3. Use round() function to round your answer to up to two decimal places. That is, use round(VALUE, 2). EXAMPLE: INPUT: 212 OUTPUT: Fahrenheit temperature 212.0 is same as 100.0 degree Celsius. INPUT: 0.555 OUTPUT: Fahrenheit temperature 0.555 is same as -17.47 degree Celsius.
